title: 114_s278
content: The "Citizen Empowerment Act" may be cited as the official title. Part III of title 5, United States Code, is amended by adding a new chapter 79A for services to members of the public. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" establishes procedures for in-person and telephonic interactions by executive branch employees regarding possible violations of federal statutes or regulations. It defines terms such as "covered interaction" and "telephonic" for clarity. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" allows individuals to record interactions with Executive agency employees at their own expense. Employees can also record interactions after informing the individual and providing a transcript upon request. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" requires Executive agency employees to provide verbal or written notice of an individual's rights before any covered interaction. Separate notifications are needed for separate violations. Individuals can have representatives make audio recordings of interactions with agency employees. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" allows representatives to make audio recordings of interactions with Executive agency employees, receive transcripts or copies of recordings, and have the same rights as the individual. The audio recordings and transcripts are the property of the individual, and there is no private right of action created by this section. Exceptions may apply. Exceptions to the "Citizen Empowerment Act" include interactions involving classified information, public safety concerns, or ongoing criminal investigations conducted by Federal law enforcement officers. Employees must provide written notification if an exception applies. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" requires written notification to individuals who are not allowed to record covered interactions. It supersedes certain laws related to recording interactions and mandates disciplinary action for violating employees. The "Citizen Empowerment Act" mandates disciplinary action for employees who violate laws related to recording interactions with individuals. Services to members of the public are covered under section 7921.
